column4: is the default calculator that comes with ubuntu known to be funny when using stored variables?
I use it a lot but not with stored variables, what are you doing? are you talking cli or X ?
i stored a number 0.160...... in memory R1. then i enter 0.412*R1 and get 11.something
which doesnt seem right to me
if i enter the 0.160andsoon number manually i get the right number
just tested that, no problems there  perhaps you hit divide?
i just did a simple calculation first to get 0.160890357 then i pressed Sto and chose R1. then i clear. enter 0.412* from the keyboard then press Rcl and chose R1 again. press = and i get 11.42734736
doing it exactly as you have told me to I get 0.066286827
but you didnt do it EXACTLY like me. because you dont know what calculation got me 0.160... in the first place.
so it must be my Sto that goes wrong
however I can put that number in storage
i get 11.4 no matter what i do
pm me this is not really channel material and if you have several steps I am willing to try it
